nodes.text: China is not fulfilling its obligations under the UN Refugee Convention.
under the UN Refugee Convention to which it is a party China is obligated not to push back asylum seekers in danger of persecution
If North Koreans who are in danger of being persecuted are being pushed back and China is obliged not to do so China is in violation of its obligations.
At any moment North Koreans risk being picked up by Chinese authorities and returned to North Korea under the terms of a secret 1986 agreement between Beijing and Pyongyang
If North Koreans are picked up in China and returned to North Korea they are in danger of being persecuted.
In North Korea anyone leaving the country without authorization is subject to three years in a labor camp or even the death penalty
Receiving three years in a labor camp or even the death penalty for leaving the country is persecution.
